Build.description: Config options for the build system.

accept_invalid_certs.description:
Allows request to ignore certificate validation errors.

Can be useful when behind a corporate proxy.

allow_self_closing_script.description:
Ignore error's related to self-closing script elements, and instead issue a warning.

Since this issue can cause the HTML output to be truncated, only enable this in case you
are sure it is caused due to a false positive.

cargo_profile.description:
Cargo profile to use.

Overrides the default chosen by cargo. Ignored if the 'index.html' has one configured.

dist.description: The output dir for all final assets

features.description: A comma-separated list of features to activate, must not be used with all-features

filehash.description: Whether to include hash values in the output file names

frozen.description: Require Cargo.lock and cache are up to date

html_output.description:
The name of the output HTML file.

If not set, the file is named "index.html"

inject_scripts.description:
Whether to inject scripts into your index file.

These values can only be provided via config file.

locked.description: Require Cargo.lock is up to date

nonce_placeholder.description: The placeholder which is used in the 'nonce' attribute.

pattern_params.description:
Optional replacement parameters corresponding to the patterns provided in
`pattern_script` and `pattern_preload`.

When a pattern is being replaced with its corresponding value from this map, if the value
is prefixed with the symbol `@`, then the value is expected to be a file path, and the
pattern will be replaced with the contents of the target file. This allows insertion of
some big JSON state or even HTML files as a part of the `index.html` build.

Trunk will automatically insert the `base`, `wasm` and `js` key/values into this map. In
order for the app to be loaded properly, the patterns `{base}`, `{wasm}` and `{js}` should
be used in `pattern_script` and `pattern_preload`.

These values can only be provided via config file.

pattern_preload.description:
Optional pattern for the app preload element [default: None]

Patterns should include the sequences `{base}`, `{wasm}`, and `{js}` in order to
properly preload the application. Other sequences may be included corresponding
to key/value pairs provided in `pattern_params`.

These values can only be provided via config file.

pattern_script.description:
Optional pattern for the app loader script [default: None]

Patterns should include the sequences `{base}`, `{wasm}`, and `{js}` in order to
properly load the application. Other sequences may be included corresponding
to key/value pairs provided in `pattern_params`.

These values can only be provided via config file.

public_url.description: The public URL from which assets are to be served

public_url_no_trailing_slash_fix.description: Don't add a trailing slash to the public URL if it is missing

root_certificate.description: When desired, set a custom root certificate chain (same format as Cargo's config.toml http.cainfo)

target.description: The index HTML file to drive the bundling process

Clean.description: Config options for the serve system.

dist.description: The output dir for all final assets

Hook.description: Config options for build system hooks.

command.description: The command to run for this hook.

command_arguments.description: Any arguments to pass to the command.

stage.description: The stage in the build process to execute this hook.

command.description: The command to run for this hook.

command_arguments.description: Any arguments to pass to the command.

PipelineStage.description:
A stage in the build process.

This is used to specify when a hook will run.

oneOf.description: The stage before asset builds are executed.
The stage where all asset builds are executed.
The stage after asset builds are executed.

backend.description: The URL of the backend to which requests are to be proxied.

insecure.description: Configure the proxy to accept insecure certificates (danger!).

no_redirect.description:
Automatically redirect proxy requests? `no_redirect` defaults to
`false`, i.e. yes, follow redirects automatically.

no_system_proxy.description: Configure the proxy to bypass the system proxy.

request_headers.description: A set of headers to pass to the proxied backend.

rewrite.description:
An optional URI prefix which is to be used as the base URI for proxying requests, which
defaults to the URI of the backend.

When a value is specified, requests received on this URI will have this URI segment
replaced with the URI of the `backend`.

ws.description: Configure the proxy for handling WebSockets.

Serve.description: Config options for the serve system.

address.description: A single address to serve on.

addresses.description: The addresses to serve on [default: <local loopback>]

csp.description: The CSP;  {{NONE}} is replaced by a random nonce

disable_address_lookup.description: Disable the reverse DNS lookup during startup

headers.description: Additional headers to send in responses

no_autoreload.description: Disable auto-reload of the web app

no_error_reporting.description: Disable error reporting in the browser

no_spa.description: Disable fallback to index.html for missing files

open.description: Open a browser tab once the initial build is complete [default: false]

proxy_backend.description: A URL to which requests will be proxied [default: None]

proxy_insecure.description: Configure the proxy to accept insecure requests

proxy_no_redirect.description: Configure the proxy to not follow redirects

proxy_no_system_proxy.description: Configure the proxy to bypass system proxy

proxy_rewrite.description:
The URI on which to accept requests which are to be rewritten and proxied to backend
[default: None]

proxy_ws.description: Configure the proxy for handling WebSockets

serve_base.description: A base path to serve the application from

tls_cert_path.description: The TLS cert file to enable TLS encryption

tls_key_path.description: The TLS key file to enable TLS encryption

ws_base.description: The path to the trunk web-socket

ws_protocol.description: Protocol used for the auto-reload WebSockets connection

Tools.description: Config options for automatic application downloads.

Watch.description: Config options for the watch system.

watch.description: Watch specific file(s) or folder(s) [default: build target parent folder]
